burlap.oomdp.stochasticgames.common

Class VisualWorldObserver

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • burlap.oomdp.stochasticgames.common.VisualWorldObserver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    WorldObserver, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class VisualWorldObserver
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements WorldObserver
    A WorldObserver that visualizes each transition with a fixed refresh delay between when the transition is rendered and when control is returned to the client.
    Author:
    James MacGlashan
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • domain

        protected SGDomain domain
        The domain this visualizer is rendering

      • painter

        protected Visualizer painter
        The visualizer that will render states

      • cWidth

        protected int cWidth
        The width of the painter

      • cHeight

        protected int cHeight
        The height of the painter

      • actionRenderDelay

        protected long actionRenderDelay
        How long to wait in ms for a state to be rendered before returning control to the world. Default is 17ms (about 60fps)

    • Constructor Detail

      • VisualWorldObserver

        public VisualWorldObserver(SGDomain domain,
                   Visualizer v)
        Iniitalizes for the given domain and visualizer.
        Parameters:
        domain - the stochastic games domain to be visualized
        v - the visualizer to use

      • VisualWorldObserver

        public VisualWorldObserver(SGDomain domain,
                   Visualizer v,
                   int cWidth,
                   int cHeight)
        Initializes
        Parameters:
        domain - the stochastic games domain to be visualized
        v - the visualize to use
        cWidth - the canvas width of the visuzlier
        cHeight - the canvas height of the visualizer

    • Method Detail

      • setFrameDelay

        public void setFrameDelay(long delay)
        Sets how long to wait in ms for a state to be rendered before returning control the world. The default value is 17, which is about 60FPS.
        Parameters:
        delay - how long to wait in ms for a state to be rendered before returning control the world.

      • initGUI

        public void initGUI()
        Initializes the visual world observer GUI and presents it to the user.

      • gameStarting

        public void gameStarting(State s)
        Description copied from interface: WorldObserver
        This method is called whenever a new game in a world is starting.
        Specified by:
        gameStarting in interface WorldObserver
        Parameters:
        s - the state in which the world is starting.

      • observe

        public void observe(State s,
           JointAction ja,
           java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> reward,
           State sp)
        Description copied from interface: WorldObserver
        This method is called whenever an interaction in the world occurs.
        Specified by:
        observe in interface WorldObserver
        Parameters:
        s - the previous state of the world
        ja - the joint action taken in the world
        reward - the joint reward received by the agents
        sp - the next state of the world

      • gameEnding

        public void gameEnding(State s)
        Description copied from interface: WorldObserver
        This method is called whenever a game in a world ends.
        Specified by:
        gameEnding in interface WorldObserver
        Parameters:
        s - the final state of the world when it ends.

      • updateAndWait

        protected void updateAndWait(State s)

      • replayGame

        public void replayGame(GameAnalysis ga)
        Causes the visualizer to be replayed for the given GameAnalysis object. The initial state of the provided game is first rendered for the given refresh delay of this object, and then each joint action is played.
        Parameters:
        ga - the game analysis object to be replayed.
